il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.construction.hit_random_generation

Class HitRandomGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.construction.hit_random_generation.HitRandomGenerator

  • public abstract class HitRandomGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for randomly generating HITs: all belonging to the same batch (with a label of that batch appearing in the ids of all generated HITs) and to the same domain.

        Parameters:
        domain - The domain over which HITs are generated.
        rand - Used as the single source of randomness for this class and extending classes.
        stateVisualizerFactory - Used to create StateVisualizer for both the original and desired states.

    • Method Detail

      • generateHit

        public Hit generateHit(java.lang.String labelToAddToId)
        The id of each new HIT returned is generated via UUID. The creation time of each new HIT is set to ZonedDateTime.now().
        Parameters:
        labelToAddToId - Will appear in the id of the generated HIT after the domain id.

      • generateHitObeyingPredicate

        public Hit generateHitObeyingPredicate(java.lang.String labelToAddToId,
                                       java.util.function.Predicate<HitConstructionInfo> pred)
        Tries again and again until successful.
        Parameters:
        pred - The predicate. Yields result given the HitConstructionInfo of the hit.

      • generateRandomRootEntityForInitialState

        @Nullable
protected abstract NliRootEntity generateRandomRootEntityForInitialState()
        This method is called once per HIT generation (at the beginning of the HIT generation process).
        Returns:
        The newly generated initial state on success, and null if this method randomly failed.

      • generateRandomFunctionCall

        @Nullable
protected abstract MethodCall generateRandomFunctionCall(State initialState,
                                                                    StateVisualizer initialStateVisualizer,
                                                                    StateVisualizer desiredStateVisualizer)
        The method is allowed to randomly fail, possibly after already emphasizing things in initialStateVisualizer and desiredStateVisualizer. The method is also allowed to randomly generate a destination state which is identical to the initial state (which is treated like a random failure).
        Parameters:
        initialStateVisualizer - for output only: emphasize things as relevant.
        desiredStateVisualizer - for output only: emphasize things as relevant.
        Returns:
        The newly generated MethodCall on success, and null if this method randomly failed. Note: it's possible this method will always fail (for certain initial states).

      • sampleUniformly

        protected int sampleUniformly(int from,
                              int toExclusive)
        Returns:
        a number in the range [from, toExclusive-1], sampled uniformly.

      • sampleOverFiniteGeometricDistribution

        protected int sampleOverFiniteGeometricDistribution(double p,
                                                    int from,
                                                    int toExclusive)
        Parameters:
        p - the success probability defining the finite-geometric distribution.
        Returns:
        a number in the range [from, toExclusive-1], sampled with a finite variant of the geometric distribution: the ratios between probabilities of different numbers is the same as in the geometric distribution, but the probabilities are normalized so their sum is 1. (The smallest number has the highest probability)

      • sampleOverFiniteGeometricDistribution

        protected <T> T sampleOverFiniteGeometricDistribution(double p,
                                                      java.util.ArrayList<T> array)
        See: sampleOverFiniteGeometricDistribution(double, int, int)

        protected <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> sampleSubsetUniformly(java.util.Collection<T> c,
                                                           int outputListSize)
        Parameters:
        c - is not modified by this method.
        Returns:
        a list with a random order.
